ground_truth: Harry and Ron are standing by Dobby's grave when Bellatrix approaches them, and we find that Hermione has transformed to look exactly like Bellatrix. Reluctantly, Griphook slides the sword into her bottomless bag as she joins Harry and Ron, who is disguised as a long-haired, bearded Death Eater. Ron holds out his hand, palm upwards, and Hermione and Harry grasp his outstretched hand; Harry then turns to Griphook, who places his hand on the others. They apparate in a dark and gloomy street by Gringott's Bank, where a cloaked man spots Hermione, who walks ahead of the others, but the cloaked man moves away. Harry bends down, and Griphook climbs on his back as Ron flings the invisibility cloak over them. Standing in the imposing banking hall, Hermione glances anxiously back at Ron, then stares wide-eyed at the rows of goblin tellers ahead of them, teetering in her unaccustomed heeled shoes. As a goblin teller looks up, she tries to look austere as she swaggers along, with Ron, wearing a long, black coat, walking behind her with his head bowed, and hidden under the invisibility cloak, Harry and Griphook follow. Harry spots an armed guard, and we note that Hermione, like Bellatrix, has a strand of long black hair over her right eye as she stops in front of a wizened old goblin behind a high desk. The goblin continues to write in his ledger as she regards him haughtily with arms folded. He looks down at her, then turns and leaves his desk while a teller looks up, and Griphook whispers to Ron, who sees an armed guard slowly pacing toward them. The old teller returns to his desk with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin, and under the cloak, Harry and Griphook have moved nearer the desk and stand beside Bogrod. Harry casts a spell, and Bogrod's demeanor changes as he smiles benignly. Griphook is driving a cart along a twisting rail track, hurtling through dark, underground tunnels, with Harry and Ron sitting on his right and Hermione on his left, and Bogrod, in his happy, mesmerized state, sitting behind his fellow goblin facing back of the track. Traveling at incredible speed, the cart's single headlight illuminates a waterfall gushing beneath the track. Griphook brakes desperately as the track twists down towards the waterfall; they pass through the cascade, and the rail-cart comes to a halt, activating an alarm. They're tipped out of the cart and plummet, but they stop falling, then land safely, and all five get to their feet and look up at the cart as it trundles away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione, and Ron recast the spell on Bogrod, who smiles benignly again, as Ron leads them in semi-darkness towards a cavern where a huge, gray, spiky dragon lies chained on the ground, and Griphook takes something from an opened wooden crate and hands it to Ron.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron are standing by Dobby's tomb when Bellatrix nears them, and we discover that Hermione has altered to appear precisely like Bellatrix. Unwillingly, Griphook slides the blade into her bottomless sack as she joins Harry and Ron, who is camouflaged as a long-haired, bearded Death Eater. Ron extends out his hand, palm upwards, and Hermione and Harry clasp his outstretched hand; Harry then turns to Griphook, who places his hand on the others. They apparate in a dim and dreary avenue by Gringott's Bank, where a cloaked figure observes Hermione, who strides ahead of the others, but the cloaked figure withdraws. Harry bends down, and Griphook climbs on his back as Ron flings the invisibility cloak over them. Standing in the imposing financial hall, Hermione glances anxiously back at Ron, then stares wide-eyed at the rows of goblin cashiers ahead of them, wobbling in her unfamiliar heeled shoes. As a goblin cashier looks up, she tries to look severe as she struts along, with Ron, wearing a long, black coat, walking behind her with his head bowed, and concealed under the invisibility cloak, Harry and Griphook follow. Harry spots an armed sentinel, and we note that Hermione, like Bellatrix, has a lock of long black hair over her right eye as she halts in front of a wizened ancient goblin behind a high counter. The goblin continues to write in his register as she regards him arrogantly with arms crossed. He looks down at her, then turns and leaves his counter while a cashier looks up, and Griphook murmurs to Ron, who sees an armed sentinel slowly pacing toward them. The old cashier returns to his counter with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin, and under the cloak, Harry and Griphook have moved closer to the counter and stand beside Bogrod. Harry casts a charm, and Bogrod's demeanor changes as he smiles kindly. Griphook is driving a trolley along a twisting rail track, hurtling through dark, underground tunnels, with Harry and Ron sitting on his right and Hermione on his left, and Bogrod, in his cheerful, mesmerized state, sitting behind his fellow goblin facing rear of the track. Traveling at incredible velocity, the trolley's single headlight illuminates a cascade gushing beneath the track. Griphook brakes desperately as the track twists down towards the cascade; they pass through the torrent, and the rail-trolley comes to a halt, triggering an alarm. They're tipped out of the trolley and plummet, but they stop falling, then land safely, and all five get to their feet and look up at the trolley as it trundles away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione, and Ron recasts the charm on Bogrod, who smiles kindly again, as Ron leads them in semi-darkness towards a cavern where an enormous, gray, spiky dragon lies shackled on the ground, and Griphook takes something from an opened wooden crate and hands it to Ron.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron are standing by Dobby's grave when they are approached by Bellatrix, and it is found that Hermione has been transformed to look exactly like Bellatrix. The sword is reluctantly slid into her bottomless bag by Griphook as she joins Harry and Ron, who has been disguised as a long-haired, bearded Death Eater. A hand is held out by Ron, palm upwards, and his outstretched hand is grasped by Hermione and Harry; Harry then turns to Griphook, who places his hand on the others. They are apparated to a dark and gloomy street by Gringott's Bank, where Hermione is spotted by a cloaked man, who walks ahead of the others, but which the cloaked man moves away from. Harry bends down, and Griphook is climbed on by him as the invisibility cloak is flung over them by Ron. Standing in the imposing banking hall, Ron is glanced anxiously back at by Hermione, then she stares wide-eyed at the rows of goblin tellers ahead of them, teetering in her unaccustomed heeled shoes. As a goblin teller looks up, an austere look is tried for by her as she swaggers along, with Ron, who wears a long, black coat, walking behind her with his head bowed, and Harry and Griphook, hidden under the invisibility cloak, following. An armed guard is spotted by Harry, and it is noted that Hermione, like Bellatrix, has a strand of long black hair over her right eye as she stops in front of a wizened old goblin behind a high desk. The goblin continues writing in his ledger and is regarded haughtily by her with arms folded. He looks down at her, then turns and leaves his desk while a teller looks up, and Ron is whispered to by Griphook, who sees an armed guard pacing slowly toward them. The old teller returns to his desk with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin, and Harry and Griphook, under the cloak, have moved nearer the desk and stand beside Bogrod. A spell is cast by Harry, and Bogrod's demeanor changes as he smiles benignly. A cart is driven by Griphook along a twisting rail track, hurtling through dark, underground tunnels, with Harry and Ron sitting on his right and Hermione on his left, and Bogrod, in his happy, mesmerized state, sitting behind his fellow goblin facing the back of the track. As the cart travels at incredible speed, a waterfall gushing beneath the track is illuminated by its single headlight. Griphook brakes desperately as the track twists down towards the waterfall; they pass through the cascade, and the rail-cart is halted, activating an alarm. They are tipped out of the cart and plummet, but they are stopped from falling, then landed safely, and all five get to their feet and look up at the cart as it trundles away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione, and Bogrod is recast with the spell by Ron, who smiles benignly again, as Ron leads them in semi-darkness towards a cavern where a huge, gray, spiky dragon lies chained on the ground, and Griphook takes something from an opened wooden crate and hands it to Ron.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron stand by Dobby's grave when Bellatrix approaches, revealing Hermione in disguise. Griphook reluctantly slips the sword into her bottomless bag as she joins Harry and Ron, who is disguised as a Death Eater. Ron extends his hand, and Hermione, Harry, and Griphook apparate to a dark street by Gringotts. A cloaked man notices Hermione, who walks ahead, but he moves away. Harry crouches for Griphook to climb on his back, and Ron covers them with the invisibility cloak. Inside the bank hall, Hermione nervously walks in heels, glancing back at Ron with hidden Harry and Griphook following. Hermione, resembling Bellatrix, approaches a goblin who leaves as another teller notices. Griphook whispers to Ron, spotting a guard. The teller returns with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin; Harry casts a spell making Bogrod smile. Griphook drives a cart through underground tunnels with Harry and Ron on his right, Hermione on his left, and Bogrod behind. The cart speeds, its headlight revealing a waterfall; Griphook brakes as they pass through it, stopping the cart and setting off an alarm. They fall but land safely, watching the cart depart. Harry turns to Ron, who recasts the spell on Bogrod as they head to a cavern with a chained dragon, and Griphook hands Ron something from a wooden crate.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron stand by Dobby's grave as Bellatrix approaches, revealing Hermione's disguise as Bellatrix. Griphook reluctantly places the sword in Hermione's bag. They join Ron, disguised as a Death Eater, and apparate near Gringott's Bank. A cloaked man notices Hermione but moves away. Harry carries Griphook under an invisibility cloak. Inside the bank, Hermione, in heels, tries to look austere. Goblins spot her as Ron hides, and Harry and Griphook follow invisibly. At a goblin's desk, Hermione folds her arms, and Griphook whispers to Ron about an approaching guard. Bogrod, a goblin, arrives, and Harry casts a spell, altering Bogrod's demeanor. In a cart driven by Griphook, they speed through underground tunnels. The cart halts after a waterfall, causing an alarm. They safely land after being tipped out. Ron refreshes the spell on Bogrod, who smiles again. Ron leads them to a cavern where a chained dragon lies, and Griphook hands Ron something from a crate.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Harry and Ron find themselves standing solemnly beside Dobby's grave when Bellatrix makes her approach toward them. However, it is soon revealed that Hermione has cleverly transformed her appearance to look precisely like Bellatrix. With a sense of reluctance, Griphook slides the magnificent sword into her seemingly bottomless bag as she approaches Harry and Ron, the latter being cleverly disguised as a long-haired, bearded Death Eater. In a show of unity and readiness, Ron extends his hand, his palm facing upwards, and both Hermione and Harry grasp his outstretched hand firmly. Harry then turns his attention to Griphook, who places his small hand on top of theirs. They all apparate together, finding themselves on a dark and gloomy street that leads to the imposing Gringott's Bank. As they arrive, a cloaked man catches sight of Hermione as she walks confidently ahead of the others, yet he decides to move away without confrontation. 

Harry bends over, and Griphook climbs onto his back, while Ron swiftly flings the invisibility cloak over them for protection and concealment. As they find themselves standing in the grand and imposing banking hall, Hermione casts an anxious glance back at Ron, then fixes her wide-eyed gaze on the seemingly endless rows of goblin tellers ahead of them, teetering slightly in her unaccustomed heeled shoes. When a goblin teller looks up from his work, she attempts to appear stern and austere, swaggering along with Ron, who follows behind her wearing a long, black coat, his head bowed low. Hidden safely under the invisibility cloak, Harry and Griphook make their silent way behind them. 

Harry's eyes quickly spot an armed guard, and we notice that Hermione, much like Bellatrix, has a singular strand of long black hair hanging over her right eye as she halts in front of an ancient, wizened goblin situated behind a high desk. The goblin continues to write meticulously in his ledger as she regards him with haughty disdain, her arms confidently folded. He glances down at her, then leaves his desk momentarily while another teller looks up, and Griphook leans closer to whisper urgently to Ron, who notices an armed guard slowly pacing in their direction. 

The old teller soon returns to his desk, accompanied by Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin. Beneath the protective cloak, Harry and Griphook discreetly move closer to the desk, standing right beside Bogrod. With a swift spell cast by Harry, Bogrod's demeanor alters, and a benign smile spreads across his face. With Griphook at the helm, a cart races along a twisting rail track deep underground, hurtling through dark, winding tunnels. Harry and Ron sit on Griphook's right side while Hermione is seated on his left, and a happily mesmerized Bogrod takes his place behind his fellow goblin, facing the end of the track. As they travel at an incredible speed, the cart's solitary headlight illuminates a waterfall gushing beneath the track. Griphook desperately brakes as the track twists downward toward the waterfall; they pass right through the cascading water, and the rail-cart comes to an abrupt halt, triggering an alarm. 

They are tipped out of the cart, plummeting through the air; however, they suddenly stop falling and land safely. All five members of the group get to their feet, gazing upwards at the cart as it trundles away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione for reassurance, and Ron recasts the spell on Bogrod, who resumes his benign smile. Ron then leads them in the semi-darkness towards a cavern where a colossal, gray, spiky dragon lies chained on the ground, an imposing sight to behold. Griphook retrieves something from within an opened wooden crate, handing it over to Ron with careful precision.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Harry and Ron find themselves standing solemnly and poignantly beside Dobby's freshly dug grave when Bellatrix makes what appears to be her approach toward them. However, it is soon cleverly revealed that Hermione has ingeniously transformed her appearance to look precisely like Bellatrix. With a sense of reluctance that hangs heavily in the air, Griphook slides the magnificent, gleaming sword into her seemingly bottomless bag as she approaches Harry and Ron, the latter being cleverly disguised to resemble a long-haired, bearded Death Eater. In a concerted show of unity and readiness, Ron extends his hand, his palm facing upwards invitingly, and both Hermione and Harry grasp his outstretched hand firmly and resolutely. Harry then diverts his attention to Griphook, who places his small, calculated hand on top of theirs. In unison, they all apparate together, finding themselves on a dark and gloomy street that ominously leads to the imposing edifice of Gringott's Bank. As they arrive, a cloaked man catches sight of Hermione as she walks confidently ahead of the others, yet he decides to move away without any confrontation.

Harry bends over, allowing Griphook to climb onto his back with practiced ease, while Ron swiftly flings the invisibility cloak over them for added protection and concealment. As they find themselves standing in the grand and imposing banking hall, Hermione casts an anxious glance back at Ron, then fixes her wide-eyed and alert gaze on the seemingly endless rows of busy goblin tellers ahead of them, teetering slightly in her unaccustomed heeled shoes. When a goblin teller looks up from his meticulous work, she attempts to appear stern and austere, swaggering along with Ron, who follows closely behind her wearing a long, black coat, his head bowed low in concentration. Hidden safely under the protective invisibility cloak, Harry and Griphook make their silent and stealthy way behind them.

Harry's sharp eyes quickly spot an armed guard, and we notice that Hermione, much like Bellatrix, has a singular strand of long, flowing black hair hanging over her right eye as she halts purposefully in front of an ancient, wizened goblin situated behind a high, imposing desk. The goblin continues to write meticulously in his ledger, as she regards him with an air of haughty disdain, her arms confidently folded across her chest. He glances down at her, then leaves his desk momentarily while another teller looks up in curiosity, and Griphook leans closer to whisper urgently to Ron, who notices an armed guard slowly pacing deliberately in their direction.

The old teller soon returns to his desk, accompanied by Bogrod, a bespectacled and bespeckled goblin. Beneath the protective cloak, Harry and Griphook discreetly and cautiously move closer to the desk, standing right beside Bogrod. With a swift spell cast by Harry, Bogrod's demeanor alters dramatically, and a benign and serene smile spreads across his face. With Griphook at the helm, a cart races along a twisting rail track deep underground, hurtling through dark and foreboding winding tunnels. Harry and Ron sit on Griphook's right side while Hermione is seated on his left, and a happily mesmerized Bogrod takes his place behind his fellow goblin, facing the end of the track as it disappears into the darkness. As they travel at an incredible and dizzying speed, the cart's solitary headlight illuminates a waterfall gushing vigorously beneath the track. Griphook desperately brakes as the track twists downward toward the rushing waterfall; they pass right through the cascading water, and the rail-cart comes to an abrupt, jarring halt, triggering an alarm that echoes loudly through the tunnels.

They are tipped out of the cart, plummeting through the air; however, they suddenly and unexpectedly stop falling and land safely on the ground below. All five members of the group get to their feet, gazing upwards at the cart as it trundles away into the distance. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione for reassurance, and Ron, with practiced familiarity, recasts the spell on Bogrod, who resumes his benign and good-natured smile. Ron then leads them in the semi-darkness toward a cavern, where a colossal, gray, spiky dragon lies chained on the ground, an imposing and intimidating sight to behold. Griphook retrieves something of importance from within an opened wooden crate, handing it over to Ron with careful and deliberate precision.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron stand solemnly by Dobby's grave, their attention drawn to the approaching figure of Bellatrix, only to reveal that Hermione has cleverly transformed her appearance to look exactly like the dark witch. With a hint of reluctance, Griphook slides the sword of Gryffindor effortlessly into the depths of Hermione's bottomless bag, which she has brought along as she joins Harry, who stands beside Ron, now in the guise of a long-haired, bearded Death Eater. Ron extends his hand with the palm facing upwards, and Hermione reaches out to grasp it, followed by Harry, who completes the circle with a firm grip. Turning to Griphook, Harry watches as the goblin places his hand on theirs, forming a tight bond. In an instant, they apparate with a soft pop, landing on a dark, gloomy street just outside Gringott's Bank. As Hermione strides purposefully ahead of the group, her confident gait catches the eye of a cloaked man who notices her visage but chooses to move away. Meanwhile, Harry bends down deliberately, allowing Griphook to clamber onto his back, as Ron deftly throws the invisibility cloak over both of them, concealing their presence. They make their way into the imposing banking hall, where Hermione pauses momentarily to glance back at Ron, her eyes filled with apprehension, before turning to face the rows of goblin tellers, teetering slightly on the unfamiliar high heels. As a goblin teller lifts his gaze from his work, Hermione attempts to project an austere demeanor, swaggering with exaggerated confidence while Ron trails closely behind, his head cast downward beneath a long black coat. Still hidden under the cloak, Harry and Griphook shadow the others. Harry's keen eyes catch sight of an armed guard, while Hermione, bearing the likeness of Bellatrix, lets a strand of long black hair fall dramatically over her right eye as she halts in front of a wizened old goblin seated behind a high desk. The goblin, engrossed in writing in his ledger, finally glances down at Hermione, who regards him with a haughty expression, her arms crossed defiantly. He rises from his desk, leaving Hermione to maintain her imperious facade, as a teller glances upward and Griphook leans close to Ron, whispering urgently about the guard who is slowly approaching. The old teller soon returns with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin, in tow. Harry and Griphook, still concealed by the cloak, have stealthily positioned themselves beside Bogrod. With a deft flick of his wand, Harry casts a spell that softens Bogrod's expression, transforming it into a benign smile. The scene shifts abruptly as Griphook commandeers a cart, navigating it along a twisting rail track with Harry and Ron seated to his right, Hermione to his left, and Bogrod, under the spell's influence, sitting contentedly behind them, facing the receding tracks. The cart hurtles through the dark, winding tunnels at an incredible speed, its solitary headlight casting an eerie glow on a waterfall cascading beneath the track. Griphook applies the brakes urgently as they careen towards the waterfall; the cart plunges through the cascading water, triggering an alarm as it comes to an abrupt halt. They are unceremoniously tipped out of the cart, plummeting briefly before landing safely on their feet. Gathering themselves quickly, all five rise to look up at the cart as it trundles away quietly. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione, prompting Ron to recast the spell on Bogrod, whose smile returns, filled with benign compliance. Leading the way through the semi-darkness, Ron guides the group towards a cavern, where their eyes fall upon a massive, gray, spiky dragon, chained and lying on the ground. Griphook carefully extracts an item from an open wooden crate and hands it over to Ron.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron stand by Dobby's grave when Bellatrix approaches, revealing Hermione has taken on her appearance. Griphook reluctantly slides the sword into her bottomless bag as she joins Harry, disguised as a long-haired, bearded Death Eater, and Ron. They grasp hands with Griphook, who apparates them to a dark street by Gringott's Bank. Upon arrival, Hermione walks ahead, drawing attention from a cloaked man who soon moves away. Harry bends down for Griphook to climb on, and Ron conceals them with the invisibility cloak. In the impressive banking hall, Hermione, unsteady in heeled shoes, anxiously looks back at Ron before focusing on the goblin tellers while Ron and the hidden Harry and Griphook follow. Hermione approaches an old goblin, feigning austerity, as Ron trails behind in a long coat. Harry, noticing an armed guard, sees Hermione’s transformation includes Bellatrix’s signature black hair strand. The old goblin leaves, returning with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin. Under the cloak, Harry casts a spell on Bogrod, altering his demeanor. In a cart driven by Griphook along a twisting track through dark tunnels, Harry and Ron sit on the right, Hermione on the left, and a mesmerized Bogrod behind. As they speed through the tunnels, the cart's headlight illuminates a waterfall beneath the track. Griphook brakes desperately, but they pass through the water, triggering an alarm as they halt. Tipped from the cart, they safely land and watch it trundle away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione as Ron recasts the spell on Bogrod. In semi-darkness, Ron leads them towards a cavern with a chained, spiky dragon, and Griphook hands Ron something from a wooden crate.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron are standing by Dobby's grave, a site marked with a simple stone on the windswept shores of Shell Cottage, when Bellatrix approaches them. We find that Hermione has transformed to look exactly like Bellatrix using Polyjuice Potion, a magical brew that allows one to assume the form of another person. Reluctantly, Griphook the goblin, who once worked at Gringott's, the wizarding bank known for its vaults filled with treasure and secrets, slides the sword into her bottomless bag enchanted with an Undetectable Extension Charm. As she joins Harry and Ron, who is disguised as a long-haired, bearded Death Eater, Ron holds out his hand, palm upwards, and Hermione and Harry grasp his outstretched hand; Harry then turns to Griphook, who places his hand on the others. They apparate, magically transporting themselves to a location, in a dark and gloomy street by Gringott's Bank, a towering white building made of marble located in Diagon Alley, where a cloaked man spots Hermione, who walks ahead of the others, but the cloaked man moves away, perhaps sensing something amiss. Harry bends down, and Griphook climbs on his back as Ron flings the invisibility cloak, a rare and valuable magical item that renders the wearer invisible, over them. Standing in the imposing banking hall, a space characterized by its grandeur and the bustling activity of goblins, Hermione glances anxiously back at Ron, then stares wide-eyed at the rows of goblin tellers ahead of them, teetering in her unaccustomed heeled shoes, reminiscent of those worn by Bellatrix. As a goblin teller looks up, she tries to look austere as she swaggers along, with Ron, wearing a long, black coat typical of a Death Eater uniform, walking behind her with his head bowed, and hidden under the invisibility cloak, Harry and Griphook follow. Harry spots an armed guard, part of the bank's stringent security measures, and we note that Hermione, like Bellatrix, has a strand of long black hair over her right eye as she stops in front of a wizened old goblin behind a high desk. The goblin continues to write in his ledger, filled with the meticulously kept financial records of wizards, as she regards him haughtily with arms folded. He looks down at her, then turns and leaves his desk while a teller looks up, and Griphook whispers to Ron, informing him of a potential threat as Ron sees an armed guard slowly pacing toward them. The old teller returns to his desk with Bogrod, a bespectacled goblin who is one of the senior staff at Gringott's, and under the cloak, Harry and Griphook have moved nearer the desk and stand beside Bogrod. Harry casts a spell, the Imperius Curse, which is one of the three Unforgivable Curses that allow one to control another's actions, and Bogrod's demeanor changes as he smiles benignly. Griphook drives a cart along a twisting rail track, a security measure to navigate the labyrinthine vaults, hurtling through dark, underground tunnels, with Harry and Ron sitting on his right and Hermione on his left, and Bogrod, in his happy, mesmerized state, sitting behind his fellow goblin facing back of the track. Traveling at incredible speed, the cart's single headlight illuminates a waterfall gushing beneath the track, known as the Thief's Downfall, which washes away enchantments and disguises. Griphook brakes desperately as the track twists down towards the waterfall; they pass through the cascade, and the rail-cart comes to a halt, activating an alarm. They're tipped out of the cart and plummet, but they stop falling due to a cushioning charm, then land safely, and all five get to their feet and look up at the cart as it trundles away, echoing through the depths. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione, and Ron recasts the spell on Bogrod, who smiles benignly again, as Ron leads them in semi-darkness towards a cavern where a huge, gray, spiky dragon, a Ukrainian Ironbelly notorious for its guarding capabilities, lies chained on the ground, and Griphook takes something from an opened wooden crate and hands it to Ron.

During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Griphook brakes desperately as the track twists down towards the waterfall. they pass through the cascade and the railcart comes to a halt activating an alarm. They are tipped out of the cart and plummet but they stop falling. then land safely and all five get to their feet and look up at the cart as it trundles away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione and Ron recast the spell on Bogrod who smiles benignly again as Ron leads them in semidarkness towards a cavern where a huge gray spiky dragon lies chained on the ground and Griphook takes something from an opened wooden crate and hands it to Ron.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron are standing by Dobby's grave when Bellatrix approaches them and we find that Hermione has transformed to look exactly like Bellatrix. Reluctantly Griphook slides the sword into her bottomless bag as she joins Harry and Ron who is disguised as a longhaired bearded Death Eater. Ron holds out his hand palm upwards and Hermione and Harry grasp his outstretched hand. Harry then turns to Griphook who places his hand on the others. They apparate in a dark and gloomy street by Gringott's Bank where a cloaked man spots Hermione who walks ahead of the others but the cloaked man moves away. Harry bends down and Griphook climbs on his back as Ron flings the invisibility cloak over them. Standing in the imposing banking hall Hermione glances anxiously back at Ron then stares wideeyed at the rows of goblin tellers ahead of them teetering in her unaccustomed heeled shoes. As a goblin teller looks up she tries to look austere as she swaggers along with Ron wearing a long black coat walking behind her with his head bowed and hidden under the invisibility cloak. Harry and Griphook follow. Harry spots an armed guard and we note that Hermione like Bellatrix has a strand of long black hair over her right eye as she stops in front of a wizened old goblin behind a high desk. The goblin continues to write in his ledger as she regards him haughtily with arms folded. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. He looks down at her then turns and leaves his desk while a teller looks up and Griphook whispers to Ron who sees an armed guard slowly pacing toward them. The old teller returns to his desk with Bogrod a bespectacled goblin and under the cloak. Harry and Griphook have moved nearer the desk and stand beside Bogrod. Harry casts a spell and Bogrod's demeanor changes as he smiles benignly. Griphook is driving a cart along a twisting rail track hurtling through dark underground tunnels with Harry and Ron sitting on his right and Hermione on his left and Bogrod in his happy mesmerized state sitting behind his fellow goblin facing back of the track. Traveling at incredible speed the cart's single headlight illuminates a waterfall gushing beneath the track. Griphook brakes desperately as the track twists down towards the waterfall. they pass through the cascade and the railcart comes to a halt activating an alarm. They are tipped out of the cart and plummet but they stop falling. then land safely and all five get to their feet and look up at the cart as it trundles away. Harry turns to Ron and Hermione and Ron recast the spell on Bogrod who smiles benignly again as Ron leads them in semidarkness towards a cavern where a huge gray spiky dragon lies chained on the ground and Griphook takes something from an opened wooden crate and hands it to Ron.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Simon and Clara are lounging by Max's fountain when Lucinda approaches them, and we find that Diana has transformed to look precisely like Lucinda. Hesitantly, Thad slips the wand into her infinite backpack as she joins Simon and Clara, who is disguised as a tall, bald wizard. Clara extends her foot, sole upwards, and Diana and Simon cling to her extended foot; Simon then turns to Thad, who places his foot on the others. They teleport to a bright and bustling marketplace by York's Tower, where a veiled woman notices Diana, who strides ahead of the others, but the veiled woman drifts away. Simon crouches down, and Thad clambers on his shoulders as Clara tosses the invisibility veil over them. Standing in the towering trading arena, Diana glances worriedly back at Clara, then gawks wide-eyed at the lines of elven merchants ahead of them, staggering in her unfamiliar metallic boots. As an elven merchant peers up, she attempts to appear stern as she saunters along, with Clara, wearing a lengthy, green robe, trailing behind her with her face covered, and hidden under the invisibility veil, Simon and Thad follow. Simon notices a patrolling officer, and we note that Diana, like Lucinda, has a braid of white hair over her left eye as she halts in front of a wrinkled old elf behind a narrow pulpit. The elf continues to sketch in his notebook as she gazes at him arrogantly with fingers interlocked. He glances down at her, then swivels and departs his pulpit while a merchant glances up, and Thad murmurs to Clara, who notices a patrolling officer gradually advancing toward them. The old merchant returns to his pulpit with Norbert, a spectacled elf, and under the veil, Simon and Thad have shifted nearer the pulpit and stand close to Norbert. Simon conjures a charm, and Norbert's expression alters as he grins cheerfully. Thad is piloting a boat along a spiraling river, zooming through dim, subterranean caverns, with Simon and Clara seated on his left and Diana on his right, and Norbert, in his joyful, captivated state, perched in front of his fellow elf facing front of the river. Navigating at extraordinary velocity, the boat's lone spotlight reveals a geyser bursting beneath the river. Thad decelerates frantically as the river spirals toward the geyser; they pass through the deluge, and the river-boat comes to a stop, triggering a siren. They're expelled out of the boat and descend, but they cease plummeting, then touch down safely, and all five rise to their feet and gaze at the boat as it rolls away. Simon turns to Clara and Diana, and Clara recasts the charm on Norbert, who grins cheerfully again, as Clara guides them in dim light towards a cavern where a massive, beige, thorny griffin lies shackled on the surface, and Thad retrieves something from an opened metal box and presents it to Clara.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry and Ron stand by Dobby's grave when Hermione, disguised as Bellatrix, joins them. Griphook reluctantly places a sword into her bag as they all hold hands, including a disguised Ron, to apparate to Gringott's Bank. There, a cloaked man spots Hermione but moves away. Griphook climbs on Harry's back as Ron covers them with the invisibility cloak. Inside the bank, Hermione, in heeled shoes, and Ron, in a coat, advance while Harry and Griphook follow invisibly. They face a wizened goblin, and after a spell from Harry, Bogrod, a goblin, becomes compliant. They ride a fast, twisting cart with Griphook driving through underground tunnels. The cart stops, triggering an alarm, and the group safely lands after being tipped out. They approach a cavern with a chained dragon, and Ron receives something from Griphook.
